title: Authors and Citation

code: @Manual{,   title = {TABS: TABS an R Package},   author = {Abraham Ruiz},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.1},   url = {https://aberuiz.github.io/TABS/}, }

title: TABS an R Package
text: package provides easier way import project data Texas Architectural Barriers System database maintained Texas Department Licensing Regulation.

title: TABS an R Package
text: can install development version TABS GitHub :
code: #install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("aberuiz/TABS") #>  #> ── R CMD build ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #>      checking for file ‘/private/var/folders/gh/fbq3g2jj4h9b09knhwdpmxpc0000gn/T/RtmptWIXQL/remotesa98a10fc3fd/aberuiz-TABS-10451e4/DESCRIPTION’ ...  ✔  checking for file ‘/private/var/folders/gh/fbq3g2jj4h9b09knhwdpmxpc0000gn/T/RtmptWIXQL/remotesa98a10fc3fd/aberuiz-TABS-10451e4/DESCRIPTION’ #>   ─  preparing ‘TABS’: #>      checking DESCRIPTION meta-information ...  ✔  checking DESCRIPTION meta-information #>   ─  checking for LF line-endings in source and make files and shell scripts #>   ─  checking for empty or unneeded directories #>        NB: this package now depends on R (>= 4.1.0) #>        WARNING: Added dependency on R >= 4.1.0 because package code uses the #>      pipe |> or function shorthand \(...) syntax added in R 4.1.0. #>      File(s) using such syntax: #>        ‘GetProjects.R’ #>   ─  building ‘TABS_0.1.0.tar.gz’ #>       #>  library(TABS)

title: TABS an R Package
text: package works primarily around one function receive projects registered TABS: GetProjects. example pull projects registered within Travis County February 29, 2024.
code: GetProjects(   county = "Travis",   reg_begin = "02/29/24",   reg_end = "03/01/24" ) #> # A tibble: 11 × 13 #>    ProjectId            ProjectNumber ProjectName ProjectCreatedOn ProjectStatus #>    <chr>                <chr>         <chr>       <chr>            <chr>         #>  1 49d1f868-09e6-46aa-… TABS20240127… ATX Kitche… 2024-02-29T22:0… Inspection C… #>  2 862b0820-4e65-4cfa-… TABS20240127… FM 973 Ret… 2024-02-29T20:5… Review Compl… #>  3 930be231-ddcb-40a4-… TABS20240127… Orrick      2024-02-29T20:0… Project Clos… #>  4 c6483eaa-317d-40cb-… TABS20240127… South Lama… 2024-02-29T17:1… Review Compl… #>  5 002ed414-d948-4528-… TABS20240127… La Carnice… 2024-02-29T14:4… Review Compl… #>  6 f2af9e71-ddd5-4e25-… TABS20240127… ACVB        2024-02-29T14:3… Project Clos… #>  7 119d43a6-943a-43a0-… TABS20240127… Play Stree… 2024-02-29T13:4… Project Regi… #>  8 43cfd9f8-6aca-450c-… TABS20240127… DOLLAR SLI… 2024-02-29T11:0… Project Clos… #>  9 a66721a4-a85b-4738-… TABS20240126… UFCU ACC H… 2024-02-29T10:2… Project Clos… #> 10 5b3a70b9-6186-4c61-… TABS20240126… AMD B200 -… 2024-02-29T09:1… Review Compl… #> 11 48fc131a-930b-4331-… TABS20240126… Vital Stre… 2024-02-29T06:2… Project Clos… #> # ℹ 8 more variables: FacilityName <chr>, City <chr>, County <chr>, #> #   TypeOfWork <chr>, EstimatedCost <dbl>, DataVersionId <int>, #> #   EstimatedStartDate <chr>, EstimatedEndDate <chr>

title: TABS an R Package
text: addition dates can search projects county, city, address, owner name, facility, /project name. example search projects City Austin owned Tesla.
code: GetProjects(   city = "Austin",   owner = "Tesla" ) #> # A tibble: 46 × 13 #>    ProjectId            ProjectNumber ProjectName ProjectCreatedOn ProjectStatus #>    <chr>                <chr>         <chr>       <chr>            <chr>         #>  1 2204d890-e4df-4414-… TABS20250217… Visitor Ci… 2025-06-20T07:2… Review Compl… #>  2 d9b4c252-d7c4-4b36-… TABS20250216… Employee a… 2025-06-18T16:4… Review Compl… #>  3 6430d938-860c-4e55-… TABS20250204… GAX PS      2025-06-04T07:3… Project Clos… #>  4 22527b2b-0091-4784-… TABS20250204… GA PS       2025-06-04T07:3… Review Compl… #>  5 bc6e75ff-e12c-4310-… TABS20250204… DU PS       2025-06-04T07:2… Review Compl… #>  6 9833e924-929c-45aa-… TABS20250204… ST2 Office  2025-06-04T07:2… Review Compl… #>  7 b4c97f71-8388-4976-… TABS20250204… ST1 Breakr… 2025-06-04T07:2… Review Compl… #>  8 435d677f-c3f0-489b-… TABS20250114… HGR         2025-02-07T14:2… Review Compl… #>  9 f87daa44-7c65-4377-… TABS20250085… Tesla - Au… 2024-12-27T15:1… Review Compl… #> 10 ecdc154a-ad93-4bf4-… TABS20250043… GA Lobby    2024-10-29T06:5… Project Clos… #> # ℹ 36 more rows #> # ℹ 8 more variables: FacilityName <chr>, City <chr>, County <chr>, #> #   TypeOfWork <chr>, EstimatedCost <dbl>, DataVersionId <int>, #> #   EstimatedStartDate <chr>, EstimatedEndDate <chr>

title: TABS an R Package
text: Registration Dates: Dates required mm/dd/yy format. automating dates, can use format(Sys.Date(), "%D"). Date arguments passed database midnight therefore, reg_begin 02/29/24 include projects starting February 29, 2024 reg_end 03/01/24 mean projects started 03/01/24 later included. Capitalization version, city county names must follow appropriate capitalization rules.

title: Get registered projects — GetProjects
text: Returns df projects registered TABS database

title: Get registered projects — GetProjects
code: GetProjects(   county = NULL,   city = NULL,   reg_begin = "",   reg_end = "",   owner = "",   project = "",   facility = "",   address = "" )

title: Get registered projects — GetProjects
text: county Texas county physical project city Texas city physical project reg_begin start date searching projects Date Format: mm/dd/yy reg_end cutoff date searching projects Date Format: mm/dd/yy owner Search owner project project Search project name facility Search facility name address Search physical address project

title: Get registered projects — GetProjects
code: GetProjects(   county = "Caldwell",   reg_begin = "03/01/24",   reg_end = "04/01/24" ) #> Error in loadNamespace(x): there is no package called ‘dplyr’ GetProjects(   city = "Austin",   owner = "Tesla",   reg_begin = "01/01/20",   reg_end = "01/01/24" ) #> Error in loadNamespace(x): there is no package called ‘dplyr’

what: Recode values to and from TDLR — TABSdecoder
title: Recode values to and from TDLR — TABSdecoder
text: submit appropriate codes TDLR return plain language values user

title: Recode values to and from TDLR — TABSdecoder
Codebook — codebook
text: Table decoding numerical codes descriptive values TDLR

title: Codebook — codebook
text: data frame 2 variables: code Numerical code value Descriptive value/label
